feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Dump BEHAVIOR_ILLEGAL_STMT_IN_CALL
entry.content:
Hello,

I am working on an On-Premise S/4HANA system and developing an application using the language version "ABAP for Cloud Development".

I am currently using the released BAdI FKK_BADI_RETURN_LOT (FKK_EVENT_0295). For this purpose, I have added the function module FKK_SAMPLE_0295_CLOUD_BADI to event 295 in FQ-Events and created a BAdI implementation. 

Within this implementation, I attempt to write data to the database with the following statement:

INSERT zal000 FROM ls_data.

However, this leads to a short dump. Interestingly, when I execute the same logic in a BAdI implementation developed with the language version "Standard-ABAP", it works without any issues.

Question:
Where can I find official documentation that indicates whether a BAdI runs in the "Save" or "Late Save" phase in the context of ABAP for Cloud Development?

Thank you in advance for your support.

Best regards,

A. Schulz

entry.title: ODATA call to RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL for std CDS view gets cs_sy_move_cast_error
entry.content:
Hi - I am calling the ODP context ABAP_CDS with ODP name IFIGLACCTLIR$F (ACDOCA)  via Synapse Analytics - however Synapse never gets a response - When using external debugging the sap side is getting a cs_sy_move_cast_error in RODPS_REPL_ODP_GET_DETAL line 134.. 

Only via external - ODATA - if I execute the FM directly in S/4 all works fine: 

I_SUBSCRIBER_TYPE = RSODP_ODATA

I_CONTEXT =  ABAP_CDS

I_ODPNAME = IFIGLACCTLIR$F

I_TYPEVERSION = 0

I_HIER_FLATTENING = NULL

This is happening on our production system - but can replicate in sandbox as well.

entry.title: /SDF/SMONの有効WP
entry.content:
ご担当者様

/SDF/SMONの有効WPの定義をご教示ください、
有効WPとはその時点で実行中のワークプロセスの合計でよいでしょうか？

有効WPには待機中のワークプロセスは含まれないという理解ですが、
これは正しいでしょうか。
弊社環境の/SDF/SMONの画面ショットを添付します。
この例だと8/29午前3:30以降、有効WPが3~4なので実行中のものが3~4で
待機中のワークプロセスが非常にあるという理解です。




------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: [S/4 hana] How can I append to /SAPAPO/MATIO table?
entry.content:
Hi Everyone!

Context:

I am trying to pass an outbound IDoc into another system, thus becoming an Inbound IDoc, this Inbound IDoc passes values, mara-rmatp_long and marc-herkl values, which is needed to be passed into /SAPAPO/MATIO fields

Is there an bapi/fm I can use for this?

these fields are currently being used in /sapapo/mat1 transactions as:

city of origin (/sapapo/matio-herkl) 

 

refP for Pack (/sapapo/matio-rmatp)

 

what I tried:

1. Append these values into mara table, but nothing is happening.

2. Directly update the /sapapo/matio

entry.title: Controlling User Access to Projects Across Cost Centers in S/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have global users who are assigned to a specific cost center (XYZ). However, these users need access to certain projects that belong to different cost centers, not all projects falling under these different cost centers. Could you please advise how this can be achieved?

So in the end, we want to restrict user access to projects regardless of the cost center they or projects belong to.

Thanks in advance,

Alp

entry.title: Program RMFPLA01 revokes the PO approval After upgrading to S/4 FPS03 2023
entry.content:
After upgrading to S/4 FPS03 2023 which was released on February 26, 2025.  on top of S/4 HANA Cloud private. , the release strategy of POs is revoked when the PO, which is released via the workflow, is opened in ME22 and the delivery date is changed. 

The issue is that the program RMFPLA01 for invoicing plan is calling ME22 in background. Consequently,  the PO approval is revoked as soon as the program RMFPLA01 runs.

Neither custom code nor implicit enhancements are used.

entry.title: SQ01 dynamic date and time filters with timestamps
entry.content:
Hi,

 

SAP EWM tables often use timestamps (e.g. /SCWM/ORDIM_C).

Because of that I can't use dynamic date and time filter with SQ01 Queries.

 

Are there any possibilities to use dynamic date and time filters here?

 

Best regards

Jonas

entry.title: Delivery split BOM component
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

i have a sales order with different items and shipping points. The sales order is composed by standard item with a specific shipping point and BOM materials with a different shipping point. During the delivery creation the system split only the father materials of the BOM, so i have standard items with a shipping point and all the components with another one. So the delivery split is correctly working only for the father material of the BOM and not for the components. How to resolve it?

It is necessary create a custom routine for the delivery batch split?

Many thanks

entry.title: SAP Build Apps – Deep Insert & Minimal Payload with S/4HANA OData (Create Inbound Deliveries)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I’m working on a scenario where SAP Build Apps connects to an S/4HANA OData service (API_INBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV/A_InbDeliveryHeader). The goal is to create inbound deliveries from Build Apps with a minimal payload and include line items via a deep entity (to_DeliveryDocumentItem).

Challenge:

Create Record node

  • Forces mapping of all ~107 fields of the header entity, even if only 2–3 fields are needed.
  • Does not expose navigation properties (deep entities) for mapping.

HTTP Destination Request

  • Facing issues with endpoint resolution.
  • The relative path seems to end up in the request body instead of the URL.
  • Calls return 400 Bad Request.

Example payload I tried (items only):

 

{
  "to_DeliveryDocumentItem": {
    "results": [
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "1000",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "10"
      },
      {
        "ActualDeliveryQuantity": "800",
        "ReferenceSDDocument": "4500000763",
        "ReferenceSDDocumentItem": "20"
      }
    ]
  }
}

 

Questions

  1. Is it a known limitation that Create Record does not support deep entities or minimal payloads?

  2. What is the recommended approach in Build Apps for:

    • Deep insert (header + items)

    • Partial updates (sending only required fields)

  3. For HTTP Destination Request, where should the relative path be set so it becomes config.url instead of being placed inside the body?

  4. Does the inbound delivery API support POST with deep entities, and what are the minimum required header fields?

  5. Any specifics to consider (e.g., $batch, sap-client, CSRF token handling)?

If anyone has a working example (endpoint + headers + minimal payload), it would be very helpful.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

Best regards,
Aman K.

entry.title: FI-TV (Travel Management): S/4HANA and Enhancement Approach with PTK99
entry.content:
Hello folks,

I got a question regarding Migration Info in SAP Note 2719018 - S4TWL - SAP Travel Management in SAP S/4HANA Suite - SAP for Me .

In before: We are using FI-TV with heavily enhanced and partially modified database and business logic making usage of the Structure PTK99 which is reused in the PCL1-TE Cluster. We are solely using WebDynpro ABAP Apps for Enduser-Processes and SAPGUI Transactions which are not yet obsolete for power users. We do not use any Fiori Apps except for MTA (not MTR) rendered within the Fiori My Inbox.

My question concerns the following passage in the aforementioned note:

"(. . .)Table PTK99: The use of table PTK99 is not supported. Instead we provide an extensibility concept (please see SAP KBA 3296253 and 3260453). If you want to manage old data in the cluster corresponding to the structure PTK99, you will need to manage the mapping between the old structure (PTK99) and new structures yourself via extensibility concept.(. . .)"

This passage seems to be related only to the newly available Fiori Apps . However, at the same time, it does not explicitly state that the approach with PTK99 will still be supported for "the old stuff". Since the codeline is not changed aside from simplifications which (as far as I can tell) do not impede on this functionality, I'm 95% sure our approach should still be technically viable, but I would sleep better at night if somebody could confirm my thesis.

*Attempting to summon @FX-Vila *

Any replies are highly appreciated!

Cheers, Lukas

entry.title: how to start learning SAP - trainings, courses
entry.content:
Hi everybody, 

I’m new here and I have a question. I want to learn SAP and am new to this technology. Yes, I know it’s pretty tough with a lot to learn. But I want to do it because I want to change my profile. My background is data warehouse development, data modeling, and ETL development. Here I want to pivot instead of diving deeper into AWS or Azure cloud; I want to learn SAP, maybe SAP BTP and Cloud.

What do you think? Are these good topics for the future and with my background? Is there anyone here who can offer advice on which courses and trainings to start with for an introduction?

entry.title: Budget Availability Control
entry.content:
Good afternoon, I have configured the budget availability control profile for cost centers in SAP 4/HANA PUBLIC CLOUD. I have created a profile where I added the general ledger hierarchy that I had previously created with a group of accounts that I want to affect the budget, and then I added the tolerance limits.

While testing, I wanted to see how a different account would affect the previously created group but with the same cost center, and I noticed that it consumes the budget.

So far, so good. Having done this, I wanted to see the tolerance limit, so I ran another test with an account loaded in the group and took it to the budgeted limit, and I saw that the limit does not cover it; it only covers it when the amount posted to the other account that does not belong to the group is increased.

Here is a brief example I have made up: Account group (601, 602, 603), budget of €3,000. I post €200 to account (620) and to the same cost center as the group. In the "
Commitments by Cost Center" application, you can visually see the consumption of the remaining €2,800 of the budget. But if I post €2801 to account (601), the limit would not mark 100%, it only does so if I mark €3001. I suppose this is because the system understands that the limit is only reached with accounts that are in the same group.

- Could someone give me more detailed information?
- Why does it appear in the application if it does not belong to the account group and is taking away from my budget?
- And why do I have to count the consumption of the other account that does not belong to the group in order to reach the tolerance limit?

I would appreciate it if someone could help me.

Best regards and thanks in advance.
